subject: Re: [junit] testing a database migration
msgSnippet: ... No, no... assertEquals(customer1, customer2)! Best of luck, and do turn your experience into an article. We d love to read it. -- J. B. Rainsberger,
messageBody:
Bauduin Raphael wrote:

> Thanks Jason for your advice.
>
> I'm indeed going to try it first on a small scale :-)
> I don't have a abstraction layer, but what I thought to do is
> work with Hibernate on both databases, and then check that all
> data for customer X in database 1 (the source) are the same in
> database 2.
>
>
> I'd do something like:
> customer1 = getCustomer(X) from db1
> customer2 = getCustomer(X) from db2
>
> assert(customer1.getName().equals(customer2.getName()))

No, no... assertEquals(customer1, customer2)!

Best of luck, and do turn your experience into an article. We'd love to
read it.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
